name: BEST WESTERN Leidse Square Hotel

reviews.text: I chose this hotel for its price, its location, and amenities such as breakfast and free wireless Internet. I was not disappointed! I had booked a double occupancy room after reading that some of the rooms were very small, and was left wondering how small a single would be. My room (359) was fine for one person but two people staying in it would be completely in each other's way. Being on the top floor, the walls slanted inward part of the way up. This took away from the spaciousness of the room, but gave the room a cozy, homelike feel which was nice. Being able to hear the rain on the roof was also nice. And the room was on a corner so it had windows on two walls.
reviews.title: Clean, cozy, comfortable -- and in a great location

reviews.text: There was a desk on one side of the bed with a TV on it, and a small but adequate closet near the door. The bed was super comfortable although the pillows were awkwardly big. The cable system offered a decent selection of English language channels (Discovery, National Geographic, CNN, BBC, TLC, Comedy Channel, and maybe a few others). The free wifi worked perfectly and there was no need to get new codes and/or re-log-in every day as at many hotels.
reviews.title: WORST-EVER

reviews.text: The staff were quite friendly. The clerk working the front desk when I arrived sopping wet at 7 am got me a cup of coffee and (even better) got me a room an hour later. Another clerk was very helpful with restaurant and tram tips.
reviews.title: Second visit to Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great part of Amsterdam -- near but not directly on lively Leidse Square, very close to Vondelpark which has a 2.5 mile running loop, and close to tram lines with direct connections to Centraal Station (lines 1, 2 and 5) and the RAI Center (line 12). The immediate neighborhood is quiet and residential, but even so my sleep was disturbed a couple of times by loud people walking by in the wee hours.
reviews.title: Do you remember the good old days when you slept in the bedroom

reviews.text: All in all, this is not a luxury hotel, but it is very comfortable and I would happily stay there again during a future visit to Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Convenient place to stay
Great fun!
reviews.text: We stayed here as we came for a short break to see Kasabien on Monday 29th Feb. The hotel is in a great location. We got a taxi from the airport which cost 40 euros, about £28 i think. Its right next to the square.

The rooms are basic but for a flying visit it was fine. The bar is small but we had a lot of fun there. It should close at 1am but we came back and was sat up til 3.30am with the barman - who i should add is lovely. I called him Stellios but im not sure his real name! The staff are really polite and welcoming and made us feel at ease. We never had breakfast so cant comment on that but my friends did and said it was really nice. Fresh bread, cheese etc The Irish pub in the square does a nice fry up if you fancy that.
reviews.title: Great location!

likes.disliked: — Dining room was a bit small for the amount of people staying there

reviews.title: Pleasant experience
reviews.text: Overall i would stay here again if i was only staying for a few days as it accomodates what i need, and the staff make it that bit nicer.

Great location base from which to explore Amsterdam. Basic amenities, but that was all we needed for a City break. Rooms were clean and serviced, breakfast was provided and there was plenty to fill up on. For the price we paid it was a great value for money and the reception staff were very helpful in answering questions, booking taxis etc. The only grumble was that there was a lot of noise in the night due to other guests coming back late!
reviews.title: This hotel is fine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is well situated and convenient for either walking or public transport. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. Rooms are clean, and breakfast was more than adequate. We arrived early so had the pick of the rooms. I would suggest rooms above the first level. All in all, if I was to visit Amsterdam again, I would have no hesitation in re-booking the `Leidse Square Hotel.
reviews.title: Bit Hit and Miss

likes.disliked: — Trying to put us in horrible room

reviews.text: I booked a double room for 4 nights. Upon arrival I was given room 210 facing the backyard, which was nice. The room had wall to wall carpet, which I found rather strange. There were no minibar in the room. There where no heating in the bathroom floor, making it very cold as there were tiles on the floor. The tv was very small and it was not a flat screen. Nice to see that the room had a safe.
reviews.title: Ok, nothing much.

reviews.text: The staff was nice, however checking in took approx 15 minutes...very slow!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very standard. Only scrambled eggs and bacon as hot dishes, which is quite ok for me. Being a Scandinavian I'm much more interested in the quality and freshness of the bread. The service was nice, however the breakfast lacked an atmosphere as there were not made any attempt making it a cosy place for eating breakfast.
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel, well situated for city centre and museums

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area around the hotel was nice. The Vondelpark was nice. Getting to RAI congress centre took 15 minutes with tram number 12, excluding a 5 min walk to tram stop in both directions.
reviews.title: good location helpful satff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would stay there again, but you will not have any problems getti g a cheaper hotel in the same area for less money.
reviews.title: no problems

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay, so I can’t understand some of the bad reviews
reviews.title: Loved it !

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights in a big double room on the 4.floor. Breakfast was good, and the staffs were polite and friendly. Location was excellent.
reviews.title: disgusting 1st room, rude staff

likes.disliked: — everything-awful hotel!! cannot believe that it can operate this way.

reviews.text: Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Corrupt Business Practice

likes.liked: — The friendly demeanor of the clerk at checkin.
likes.disliked: — The cold, indifferent attitude of the clerk at checkout.

reviews.text: we booked into this hotel for 2 nights, our 1st room was not ready, had stains in the bed from the previous nights activity's! stinking and full of rubbish, when we informed staff they were rude and condescending. basic breakfast. i would not recommend this hotel- to anybody!!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: While visiting friends in Belgium, we decided to take a trip to the Netherlands and visit Amsterdam. We waited until we got there to find a hotel in an area we thought would be best. Many of the hotels we went to (Marriott, Park, etc.) were already booked. We found the Leidse Square Hotel and were told there were two rooms left and the rate would be €149 + 5% for each room. We opted to take the last two rooms, one right inside the front door and one in the basement. The basement room smelled moldy and there was continuous employee traffic throughout the night opening and closing squeaky doors. The ground floor room wasn't bad with the exception of the midnight gathering of about a dozen people. My complaint came upon checkout. When we checked out of the hotel, we were given a bill of €175 + 5%. When questioned, the female desk clerk stated that was always the room rate. The mistake we made was not getting the price quote in writing.
reviews.title: clean friendly and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel! The location is excellent, really close to Leidseplain and many Tram lines, restaurants, Vondelpark and commercial center. Walking distance from Museumplein.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is bigger than average in Europe, so is the bathroom. Room and bathroom were clean enough, no complaints. I would say the only bad thing is that the room is so big that the heater was not able to warm it enough during the night and that were no extra blankets in the closet. But this is a really small detail in a great stay.
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.text: One other negative point: internet access (wi-fi) available but too expansive!!!
reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful when we needed some information about the city and tours. Breakfast is great: 3 or 4 kinds of bread, cheese, eggs, tea, juices, milk. Even more than expected.
reviews.title: Very conveniently located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would certanly recommend it!!
reviews.title: Great location, breakfast, staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Leidse Square Hotel for a weekend in October 2011. The staff we both friendly and helpful on check-in. The room itself was basic but clean. Rooms were quite expensive 350 Euro for 3 nights, without breakfast. Good location, just next to the Vondelpark behind the Marriott hotel . usually use priceline for Amsterdam hotels, but would return to this hotel again... not bad at all. Downside.... the Mattresses were really uncomfortable... like blamanche.... ( but not pink )
reviews.title: Clean Hotel, Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful; room was not the biggest but enough space and very, very clean. Bathroom was modern with a great shower. Breakfast was plentiful. Best thing was the location - within minutes walk of the Van Gogh Museum; the Hard Rock Bar; the Leidseplein and shops.
reviews.title: Excellent location and friendly hotel.

reviews.text: We took a taxi from the train station - a bit of a sting at 20 Euro. There are many trams stopping close by but best way to get about is on foot.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel on a lovely avenue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next to Vondelpark and a short walk to bars, restaurants and Heineken Brewery. Lovely setting on a lovely avenue. Room was clean, staff were welcoming, breakfast room pleasant. Could not really fault this hotel. Would definitely stay again if I ever visited again but for me Amsterdam has priced itself right out of the market. Everywhere so expensive. One bar was 4.65 euros for half lager or 5.65 for a pint.
reviews.title: Nice! And very close to main square!
We will do our best :(
reviews.text: There was a teeny wait upon checking in, but there was a tourist group waiting to check out. The receptionist was wonderful. The room was HUGE. We were in the basement, but there was a wall of windows to the front street. It was very quiet and very clean. It is within a few blocks of the main square in Amsterdam, just at the edge of the canal loop. We felt very safe walking around the neighborhood at night when returning to the hotel. Being away from the main square meant we had a wonderful quiet evening. Breakfast the next morning was lovely. Lots of different things to choose from and even fresh fruit and hot items.

Easy hotel to find, quiet location but still near enough to public transport and bars/restaurants/shops. Large clean rooms with plenty of towels and fresh linen, good fresh breakfast, helpful and friendly staff. Would definately stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel in Amsterdam

likes.disliked: — Check-in time could have been a little earlier 12 instead of 2pm.

reviews.text: April 15-20, 2007: We recently stayed several nights and were pleasantly surprised. We had researched several other hotels via the web in the hopes of finding a hotel near the city center but a little away from the late night noise. This hotel was perfect! The location was great. You can use the local public transportation system to reach the hotel from either the airport or Central Station. From the Central Station use Trams 1,2, or 5 and get off at the Leidseplein stop. A short walk from there you reach the hotel which is directly behind the Marriot. Breakfast is nothing special other than it being included in the price. It typically consisted of breads, meats and cheeses, yogart, hard boiled eggs, and a meager selection of cereal. You also get juices and coffee. The best thing about the hotel is its location and easy access to the Leidseplein which is where you have numerous choices for restaurants and the local public tram lines.
reviews.title: Not Bad

likes.disliked: — Lack of room amenties such as coffee/tea

reviews.text: We booked a superior room thinking it would be the best. Wrong! There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the rooms and the hotel generally had a gloomy atmosphere. The staff were a little helpful but didn't go out of their way. The room was cold and dank. I was more than dissapointed for the money we paid and would not reccomend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Don't bother

reviews.text: I'd read some reviews saying that rooms were small and dirty so I was a little apprehensive. Our room was quite large, having 3 windows looking out of the back of the hotel and so was very quiet. Although the furnishings were perhaps in need of an update, the room was clean. The bathroom was large. It was good that there was a separate area for smokers in the breakfast room. There was a good selection of food here. The staff were friendly and very helpful too. I would have no hesitation staying here again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Perfect location in good area of Amsterdam. Breakfast better than expected. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and warm, (it was bitterley cold with snow)! Our friends had much larger and more superior room than ours for the same price. Know we should have mentioned it to Reception staff but did not. Felt we paid over the top but enjoyed our 3 night stay very much. Loads of places to eat locally and lots to enjoy even in bad weather. Got tram and train back to Airport.
reviews.title: Good location

likes.disliked: — We paid too much for the small room/no safe etc.

reviews.text: 12 females visited this hotel and every detail of the hotel was excellent. The toilets were very clean, fresh towels were given every day, staff were very friendly and most helpful and the dining room was very clean and the food was great value for money with plenty choices for everyone. Great experience and very central for all tourist attractions. The Heineken Brewery is a must to visit.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Having to pay for internet access

reviews.title: Leidse Sq = Great!
reviews.text: Having read the reviews on here after booking we were a bit panicked and didn't know what to expect, but the hotel is great! We checked in at midnight on a Friday, the room was clean and quiet, the hotel location is ideal, and the staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is ok, had better, had worse. We booked through Hotel Connect, the whole system ran smoothly from start to finish and I'd recommend them too. We paid about £180 for 3 nights, bargain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, away from the general noise of Amsterdam at night, but just a few minutes walk away from one of the citys main squares. The staff were great and answered any questions we asked, the room was spotless and cleaned daily. The
reviews.title: A pleasant suprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast was good enough to keep us going till dinnertime. For the price we paid for the whole package I was expecting the hotel to be a bit naff, but it was perfect to use as a base to see the city. All in all
reviews.title: Better than expected...

reviews.text: great value and a great location.
reviews.title: Great Service

likes.liked: — Service, the staff were very friendly and helpful
likes.disliked: — walls are a liitle thin, some noise from late night revellers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived here with friends for a very brief stay ( two nights) and found it to be a very clean and tidy place. Nice situation not far from the bustle of Leidsplein but in a quiet street.
reviews.title: Very good value and close to lots of venues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had no problems with reception when we arrived and was treated very politely - - with a smile too.
reviews.title: Great location close to leidseplein & good hotel for a medium budget

reviews.text: Breakfast was good with a well maintained/stocked buffet.
reviews.title: Good Location but rude front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not use the bar so cannot comment - - we were out late elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great location and nice service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We all enjoyed our stay but I would point out to those that need it - - its a no smoking hotel with a 200 euro fine if caught!
reviews.title: Good Location, Weak Hotel

reviews.text: We only stayed here one night on a whistlestop break. We had room 360 which, though a little small, was perfectly sufficient. We were situated at the back of the hotel. We had a good nights sleep owing to the quiet setting, also what looked to be new mattresses (if not new were nearly new!). Good bathroom with basic toiletries and wall hanging hairdrier provided. Staff very friendly - main doors kept locked at night which is reassuring, though hotel is situated on a back street. We paid 75 euros for a buffet style breakfast - plenty of variety and kept replenished by the helpful staff. 24 hour reception which is useful. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value - central location

reviews.text: Just got back after 5 night stay. Very clean. Good breakfast. Friendly and helpfull staff. Ask for a room on the back for quiter sleep.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel.

reviews.text: Overall: will stay there again on my next visit.
reviews.title: Top value and a great location

reviews.text: We paid just €65 for a double room for one night, booked a couple of days before travel. At that price it was terrific value for money. The hotel is in a quiet residential street very close to the city centre with good restaurants, trams and many of the main attractions within short walk. Our room quite small but adequate and spotlessly clean with a comfortable bed and a good bathroom. The staff are friendly and there's a good bar. Breakfast is good value at €7.5 Euros if you pay at check-in time (otherwise €10).
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Judging by some of the other reviews, not every room is as good as ours. But you can only go by your own experience and I would highly recommend the Best Western Leidse Square.
reviews.title: functional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a hotel in the popular Leidse Square area that is back off of the busy streets. We stayed in four nites in May. On the pluses it is in a quiet location and convenient to many sites including the museums. There is free internet access with no restrictions in the lounge. The breakfasts are fairly good in quantity with a wide selection of items to choose from. The rooms however are dreadly small. Our room on the first floor had been divided in two and was approximately 120 square feet. The windows are single paned and any noise out in front you will hear nearly every word. The bathroom however was great and everything in the room was cleaned daily by the staff.
reviews.title: Small Quet Room But Needs Helpful Front Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the negative site the front desk staff are not helpful. Simple questions as if you could mail a postcard for me were not answered. If you make your reservation late you are told that breakfast is not included in the rate. While at the computer I noted some inconsistencies in what various single persons who showed up unannounced were charged. So please check the rates in advance. After paying for the room on the third day of our staff the front desk person indicated they had mistake on the rate and demanded that we pay an additional 40 euros because of an internal mistake.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location (once we found it) in quiet area although still central.
reviews.title: Everyone is right...great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we were allocated was fairly small and on the dark side – we had requested a bright room, but not complaining as it served its purpose, was nice and warm / well equipt.
reviews.title: Prime location & very affordable, could use better front desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was continental buffet style – plenty of everything and of a good standard seating area spacious and bright, lots of seating.
reviews.title: A Good Hotel and Location - No Question

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is excellent, just off Leidseplein but in quiet road. Don't expect luxury but what you get is a very clean room with comfortable new-looking beds for a good (warm) nights sleep in freezing Amsterdam! Bathroom was smallish but had all facilities with a selection of toiletries and plenty of towels changed every day. The tea tray was much appreciated although the milk could be improved upon. Reception staff were always polite to us, the barman was chatty and friendly. We did not encounter any noisy fellow guests as others have.
reviews.title: Quiet location in lively Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When booking to visit Amsterdam, many hotels seemed to charge extra for breakfast. It was included here and was more than adequate with cereals, fruit, ham cheese, a selection of bread and boiled eggs together with juices and tea and coffee. We were quite satisfied with this.
reviews.title: Exactly what you expect from a Best Western

reviews.text: If you want good clean comfortable facilities in a quiet yet convenient and central area with a decent breakfast then I would recommend this Best Western hotel to you. We were always happy to return there after a day sightseeing.
reviews.title: Quiet, good price, quite good locations, helpful staff

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights (Saturday and Sunday) as part of a city break in Amsterdam. The location and exterior of the hotel I can't fault at all. If you don't plan on spending 'quality' time in your hotel, this is the place for you. Our room was larger than I am used to in European city hotels, with a predictably small but clean and functional bathroom with a frankly lovely shower over a good sized bath.The sheets weren't changed during our stay but the bed was turned down and towels changed so this is fine. Breakfast was good enough with nice quality food but the Sunday morning was crazy! I recommend getting in there early to avoid the rabble of students and families all cramming around the toast machine, we went down at 10am when the breakfast ends at 10.30 so that was our mistake!! The hotel interior itself is tired and old which is a shame and the reception desk had a multitude of different staff, some very helpful with letting us borrow an umbrella to some with barely any English who seemed reluctant to give us our key. Which brings me to another flaw - you drop your key off on your way out and buzz to get back in and ask for your key. Very odd I thought, not sure if they have a lot of people running off without paying or something!! Another thing to be aware of it is on the face of it, we thought the hotel was quiet but quickly realised that the soundproofing between floors is not great (leading us to think a family of elephants had rented the room above us!) and the sheer multitude of students and groups means a bit too much running around and laughing in the corridors at 4 in the morning for my liking. Not sure who on earth uses the frankly pointless bar next to reception when you are on the doorstep of so many great brown bars, clubs and pubs - the only people seemed to be a group of the hotel staffs friends who were all middle-aged men.
reviews.title: Ok, probably wouldn't stay here for a personal vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a great base to discover Amsterdam if don't expect the Ritz. It isn't dirty, it is functional and in some ways comfortable - which is really what you should expect from your average Best Western!
reviews.title: Dangerous. They either don't have building codes in AMS or they are not inspected.

description: Multistory Hotel housed in 19th-century building within a short walk to Leidseplein, bars, nightclubs & the Municipal Theatre.
